'company': 'Central Asia Online', 'description': 'During my work for this media organization in Kabul, Afghanistan, I have provided breaking news stories, opinion pieces, interviews and photos of attacks, events, developments and issues from across the country. 

I have been working in the field of media for quite a long time. I have worked with several Pashto, Urdu and English language local and international newspapers, magazines, radio channels and online outfits.', 'title': 'Correspondent', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Centre for Conflict and Peace Studies (CAPS), Kabul, Afghanistan', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Centre for Conflict and Peace Studies (CAPS), Kabul, Afghanistan', 'description': 'At CAPS, I worked as Research Analyst with a team of very competent and professional researchers and analysts. I went for field studies, wrote comprehensive asessments, and contributed to many research projects.

Also at CAPS, participted in many international conferences where I represented my organization and Afghanistan and took part in the discussions related to Afghan issues. 

During my work here, I did some research on the insurgent groups that are currently active in Afghanistan and Pakistan and not only wrote their profiles but also prepared presentations and presented them to the relevant organizations. 

I also wrote a complete and comprehensive assessment of the inside conditions of Pul-e-Charkhi prison and assessed the problems and challenges that the prisoners and detainees faces during time in the prison and the legal procedure. I also took part in the reconciliation and reintegration efforts.', 'title': 'Research Analyst', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Paiwastoon Networking Ltd., Kabul, Afghanistan', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Paiwastoon Networking Ltd., Kabul, Afghanistan', 'description': 'At Paiwastoon, I mainly translated websites and softwares and localized the technical and educational content that was put in the customized laptops from One Laptop Per Child (OLPC) project. 

The softwares and programs that I translated from English into Pashto during my work here included Mozilla Firefox, Etoys, Google, Joomla, and many other programs and games. I also translated educational material for children.', 'title': 'Pashto translator and localizer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Afghan Islmaic Press (AIP)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Afghan Islmaic Press (AIP)', 'description': "Afghan Islamic Press is a Peshawar-based Afghan news agency where I worked as News Editor. 

During my work at AIP, I gathered news stories from the agency's reporters across Afghanistan and talked to officials, anti-government elements and other related people to get the details confirmed. 

Also I edited stories written by other editors and reporters and translated some of the press releases. 

In urgent situations, I called the subscribers of the agency and told them the storeis and breaking news on phone. 

I also monitored the agency's website when it was updated and sometimes updated it myself. My work was in Pashto, Urdu, and English.", 'title': 'News Editor', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Daily Wahdat (Pashto)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'company': 'Daily Wahdat (Pashto)', 'description': 'Daily Wahdat was the first major Pashto newspaper that covered Afghanistan from Peshawar during the civil war and before and after that. 

I worked with daily Wahdat as editor and wrote regular columns in Pashto. I also translated some good articles and stories from English and Urdu newspapers. 

I edited special editions of this newspaper on the 2005 Presidential Election in Afghanistan and many other issues.', 'title': 'Editor', 'employment_type': None}]}]
